questions.text: A 60 years old male patient believes that his thoughts and feelings are controlled by some external agency. This is? (FMGE recent)
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Delusion of influence

Nihilistic delusions or delusions of negation occur when the patient denies the existence of their body, their mind, their loved ones and the world around them.

Delusions of influence are a ‘logical’ result of experiences of passivity in the context of schizophrenia. These passivity feelings may be explained by the patient as the result of hypnotism, demonical possession, witchcraft, radio waves, atomic rays or television. (Fish’s)

questions.text: Tactile hallucinations seen with use of cocaine are known as:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Formication (Definition)

questions.text: Hemp insanity is related to which substance?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Cannabis (Ref : Niraj Ahuja)

‘Hemp insanity’ or cannabis psychosis: Indian hemp insanity was first described by Dhunjibhoy in 1930. It was described as being similar to an acute schizophreniform disorder with disorientation and confusion, and with a good prognosis.

questions.text: A young man gets sudden and irresistible urge to carry out an act.  Which of the following is an impulse control disorder? (*)
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Sudden irresistible urge to carry out an act is impulse

Intermittent explosive disorder is an impulse control disorder

questions.text: On Mental status examination, patient is asked to subtract 7 from 100. What does it assess? (FMGE)
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Although serial 100-7 subtraction test is for both attention and concentration

But concentration is a better answer here than attention

questions.text: Clinical history is suggestive of premature ejaculation in male, with history of relationship conflicts with wife. Non pharmacological treatment for the couple used in this condition? (NEET PG 2023)
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Squeeze therapy

In cases of premature ejaculation, an exercise known as the squeeze technique is used to raise the threshold of penile excitability. In that exercise, the man or the woman stimulates the erect penis until the earliest sensations of impending orgasm and ejaculation are felt. Penile stimulation is then stopped abruptly, and the coronal ridge of the penis is squeezed forcibly for several seconds. The technique is repeated several times.
During those exercises, called sensate focus exercises, the couple is given much reinforcement to lessen anxiety. They are urged to use fantasies to distract them from obsessive concerns about performance, which is termed spectatoring.

questions.text: A 25 year old patient presented with complaint that aliens are communicating with him they are sending an electromagnetic radiation to his brain and aliens are asking him to kill his distant relatives. His relative said he has this disease from last 20 years, The patient does not work on farm and stopped going in social functions, patient is aware of time, place and person. What is the most likely diagnosis? (FMGE)
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Schizophrenia

“that aliens are communicating with him they are sending an electromagnetic radiation to his brain and aliens are asking him to kill his distant relatives” (Auditory hallucinations commanding the patient : first rank symptom)

Duration more than 6 months (20 years chronic continuous)

Social impairment

questions.text: A 20-year-old male presented with complains of irritability, hearing voices, suspiciousness since 4 days following an episode of fever. What is the probable diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Brief Psychotic Disorder
BRIEF PSYCHOTIC DISORDER:
Symptoms similar to Schizophrenia
Onset- Acute
Often preceded by a stressor
Often resolves completely
Duration- <1 month
Rx- Antipsychotics
Reference: Kaplan & Sadock’s Synopsis of Psychiatry, 12th edition

questions.text: A 46-year-old female came to the OPD with her husband, with complains that she is hearing multiple voices in her ears, commenting on her actions with derogatory manner, suspicious that her neighbours are trying to hurt her and that she is being tracked by them since 3 years. She also complains that she is not getting adequate sleep since then. Her husband reports that she hardly interacts with him. She does not interact with any one much. No precipitating factor could be elicited. Which of the following is not a poor prognostic factor in the case described?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Presence of positive symptoms

The clinical picture described in the above question is suggestive of Schizophrenia. Presence of psychotic symptoms such as auditory hallucinations and delusion of persecution, female sex and late age of onset goes in favour of good prognosis, where as the absence of precipitating factor, reduced interaction, and duration of illness goes in favour of poor prognosis

questions.text: All of the following are true about "Late onset schizophrenia" except:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Onset after 40 y of age

Cut off is onset after 45 y of age to call as late onset schizophrenia

questions.text: What is the term used to describe increased sexual desire in males? (NEET)
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C).

Increased sexual desire in males is known as satyriasis

Increased sexual desire in females is known as nymphomaniac

choices.text: Cluster C: Obsessive compulsive personality disorder

questions.text: Which of the following is incorrectly matched:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B)

questions.text: What is the key common symptom of depression? (FMGE)
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Low mood

(Ref : Kaplan Psychiatry Pg 365)

Low mood is key symptom of depression.

Generalized psychomotor retardation is the most common symptom of depression, although psychomotor agitation is also seen, especially in older patients

questions.text: A 19-year-old boy was brought to ER with complains of irritability and reduced sleep since 4 days. On examination, patient was found to be talking continuously and he could not be stopped, saying that he knew the PM & President of the country. Following assessment, he was admitted in a psychiatric facility. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Mania
 
Although the patient had the symptoms for only 4 days (duration criteria for mania is 7 days), the symptoms are severe enough for admission.
If there are severe symptoms which warrant admission, then it is diagnosed as mania.

questions.text: Patient has had manic and depressive episodes and needs treatment. Which of the following causes least weight gain? (FMGE JAN 2024 )
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Ziprasidone (reference : Maudsley clinical guidelines 13th )

Ziprasidone causes least weight gain

questions.text: Which of the following antidepressants is most selectively serotonergic? (**)
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Escitalopram  
Escitalopram is the most selective inhibitor of serotonin reuptake, with negligible effects on the reuptake of other monoamines such as norepinephrine or dopamine. It does not have any clinically significant effect on histaminergic, GABAergic, or acetylcholinergic transmission. Paroxetine has clinically significant anticholinergic activity. Fluoxetine weakly inhibits norepinephrine reuptake and binds to 5-HT2C receptors. Sertraline weakly inhibits both norepinephrine and dopamine reuptake

questions.text: A  patient presented in emergency with chest pain and no medical cause was found and patient told 10 days ago he was robbed on gun point in his house. When doctor wanted to discharge him he refused to go back to his home. His family member told his pre morbid condition before this incident was normal. Likely diagnosis? FMGE JAN 2024
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Acute onset anxiety symptoms with avoidance, 10 days after a major trauma with avoidance (refuses to go home), points towards diagnosis of acute stress reaction.

questions.text: Capgras syndrome can be associated with which of the  following condition? FMGE July 2023
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Dementia with lewy body, commonly has CAPGRAS SYNDROME

It is 2nd most common cause of dementia in elderly
Fluctuating cognitive impairment
Parkinson like symptoms
Subcortical dementia
Has REM sleep behavioural disorder
Antipsychotics are contraindicated
Predominant visual hallucinations

questions.text: Which of the following personality subtype is more prone to develop “folia-a-deux”? (DNB)
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Dependent 
Dependent and weak members of family are more likely to share the delusions of strong members of family.

choices.text: Delusion of grandiosity, persecution and reference

questions.text: A patient believes he is the most important person in the world than anyone so his neighbours and family is trying to harm him as they are jealous of him. His wife says otherwise and says he behaves like this recently only before he was working as a school teacher peacefully and brought to OPD. He is suffering from? (AIIMS)
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Delusion of grandiosity and persecution 

(Ref : Fish’s psychopathology)

Feeling that I am the most important person in the world is grandiosity and family is jealous of him, want to harm him is persecution. Its not uncommon for persecution and grandiosity to co-exist.

questions.text: A patient presented to us with feeling low, hopeless about future, negative emotion, lack of interest, decreased sleep. He reports having similar episode 5 months/5 years back from which he completely recovered. What is the likely diagnosis? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Recurrent depressive disorder

RDD means more than 2 episodes of depression, at least 2 months apart.

questions.text: A 28 year old mother was diagnosed with mild depression, she has a 3 month old child. Which among the following therapy should be prescribed ? (FMGE)
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

A Cognitive behavioural therapy

Mild depression, lactating women, psychotherapy alone is the first line of treatment

questions.text: Which of the following is not a characteristic feature of atypical depression?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Obsessional symptoms
Atypical Depression:
It is characterized by depressed mood, but with reactive affect. Vegetative signs are reversed with hypersomnia, hyperphagia, reversed diurnal mood variation, leaden paralysis, and hypersensitivity to rejection. Effects of MAO inhibitors are better than other antidepressants.
 
Reference: Kaplan & Sadock’s Synopsis of Psychiatry, 12th edition

questions.text: A patient having decreased sleep and decreased appetite for last 6 months, also having death wish and has now developed a new symptom for last 2 weeks in form of voices telling him to die, along with persistence of previous symptoms. Treatment (NEET 20)
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

The diagnosis is severe depression with psychotic symptoms (mood congruent delusions and suicide provoking auditory hallucinations).

Best treatment is antidepressant and antipsychotic, both.

questions.text: A 40-year-old woman presents with complaints of not being able to leave her house. For the past 5 years, she has had increasing difficulty traveling far from home. She constantly worries that she will not be able to get help if she “freaks out.” In fact, she has had numerous unprovoked episodes of intense fear, associated with shortness of breath, chest pain, diaphoresis, and dizziness, that lasted for 20 minutes. She is convinced that if she drives too far from home, she will have an attack and not be able to obtain help. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

This woman most likely has panic disorder with agoraphobia. She experiences recurrent spontaneous panic attacks and between attacks worries about having further attacks. She avoids driving away from her home for fear of being unable to obtain help in the event of an attack.

questions.text: A 25 year female was referred to psychiatrist from plastic surgeon. She wants her entire face changed, repeated visits to plastic surgeons for face deformity, she repeatedly checks her face in mirror. She would constantly examine herself on utensils and spoons complaining about spots and blemishes that are not present.  She wouldn’t change her mind even after family members constantly advising her. Which is best preferred treatment? (NEET PG 2024 AFTERNOON)
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Clinical history suggestive of BDD, body dysmorphic disorder, which is a part of OCD and related disorders, and the first line treatment is SSRI (for all neurotic disorders).

questions.text: A girl with a history of loss of consciousness episodes only in front of family members and only in day time. Patient can recall the events at the time of episode, when she regains conscious after 5-10 min, no tongue bite, no history of fecal or urinary incontinence. EEG and MRI brain were normal. Select the true statement regarding her treatment:- (NEET PG 2024 AFTERNOON)
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Clinical history is suggestive of conversion/pseudoseizure, where the first line of treatment is behavioural therapy.

questions.text: 45 yr old female has feeling of nervousness/feeling tensed, having stomach upset with heartburn/dyspepsia and diarrhea since many years. She also tells her family members are also tensed and nervous. Which additional symptom can be seen in this patient? (NEET PG 2024 MORNING)
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Symptoms mentioned in Q here like nervousness/tensed etc are anxiety symptoms, present for many years, suggestive of GAD.(Generalized anxiety disorder)

GAD also has tingling numbness.

All other options here are psychotic symptoms.

questions.text: An elderly cancer patient developed symptoms of DELIRIUM, post anaesthesia. What is the initial management/drug to be used? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Haloperidol

DOC Delirium (any etiology) : Haloperidol
DOC Delirium Tremens : IV lorazepam

questions.text: On physical examination, you notice that a person with a history of substance use, now has pilo-erection, dilated pupils, rhinorrhea, and he is yawning frequently. Withdrawal from which of the following substances can cause this presentation?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Opiate
 
These features are suggestive of opiate withdrawal.

Opiate withdrawal:

Appears in 4 to 12 hours of last opiate use and subsides within a week.

Clinical features:

Muscle aches and cramps

Insomnia

Diarrhea

Rhinorrhea

Lacrimation

Dilated pupils

Yawning

Piloerection [cold turkey]

questions.text: Which of the following is not a negative symptom in Schizophrenia?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Automatism (Ref: Kaplan Synopsis of Psychiatry 11th edn)

Alogia, Affective flattening and Anhedonia are negative symptoms of schizophrenia. Automatism is seen in seizures

questions.text: A patient presented to the psychiatry OPD. On being asked what's your name', patient repeated the same question. This phenomenon is called?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Repeating examiners words is echolalia

questions.text: Which is the most common symptom of Narcolepsy?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Day time sleep attacks is most common symptom

questions.text: A woman would get anxious, mood swings with occasional sleep disturbance and weeping episodes after birth of child and got referred from Obstetrics dept after 5 days post delivery. What is most probable diagnosis of this condition ? (NEET PG 2022)
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A)

questions.text: A middle aged man suddenly becomes detached, and starts writing poems and stories, although it couldn’t be understood by anyone because of language and context was also not rational. This is a disorder of ______?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Form of thought

The clinical sign described is “Neologism” which is form of thought disorder.

choices.text: Patient who talk about suicide rarely commit suicide
All suicidal threats are not to be taken seriously
Asking about suicide will often reduce the anxiety surrounding the feeling
Amongst all risk factors of suicide, hopelessness is most important risk factor

questions.text: All of the following are not true about suicide except?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Asking about suicide will often reduce the anxiety surrounding the feeling

MYTHS ABOUT SUICIDE

questions.text: A 30-year-old man was brought to the Accident and Emergency Department. He suddenly fell down after hearing a loud sound at a party. There was no loss of consciousness. The psychopathology being described is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Cataplexy

Cataplexy refers to temporary paralysis and loss of antigravity muscle tone without loss of consciousness. Cataplexy is often precipitated by
emotional excitement and associated with narcolepsy.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a REM sleep disorder?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Night terror

Night terrors are dreadful dreams that occur in NREM sleep.

questions.text: Repetitive, voluntary, purposeful movements are called
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)
This is the definition of mannerism. Stereotypy is the constant repetition of meaningless and purposeless gestures or movements.
In automatism, the individual is consciously or unconsciously, but involuntarily, compelled to perform certain motor or verbal acts.

questions.text: A patient in OPD is very much obsessed with particular things.  He seems to be stubborn and frugal in nature. As per Sigmund Freud’s psychosexual stages of development, Fixation would have happened in which stage? FMGE July 2023
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

FREUD’S PSYCHOSEXUAL STAGES OF DEVELOPMENT
